name: Fractured Animal Sayings and Idioms Trivia Game | Brain Teasers | 10 Questions

questions.correct: Ive got all my ducks in a row & I've got all my ducks in a row&I ve got all my ducks in a row
questions.explanation:
Ive got all my ducks in a row & I've got all my ducks in a row&I ve got all my ducks in a row.

	As in a shooting gallery. This means that one's life is in good order or proceeding just fine.

questions.correct: Cat got your tongue&Cat's got your tongue&Cats got your tongue
questions.explanation:
Cat got your tongue&Cat's got your tongue&Cats got your tongue.

	Ouch! My cats have playfully bitten my face, but never my tongue, thank goodness. This saying means: Why are you so reticent?

questions.correct: The early bird catches the worm
questions.explanation:
The early bird catches the worm.

	In other words, don't procrastinate. A ketch is a kind of sailing ship.

Stubborn as a mule.

	Horses can be stubborn, too. The acronym NASA stands for "National Aeronautics and Space Administration." "Mewl" is a synonym for "whimper."

questions.text: Anne Ella flint neighbor fur kits?
questions.explanation:
An elephant never forgets.

	Elephants do seem to mourn their dead, so perhaps this saying is based on fact.

Wise as an owl.

	I assume that owls are fairly intelligent, but their big round eyes and big flat faces make them look even brainier than they are.

questions.correct: Curiosity killed a cat & Curiosity killed the cat
questions.explanation:
Curiosity killed a cat & Curiosity killed the cat.

	In other words, look before you leap and don't be too nosy. My kitten Matty has a few times almost fallen victim to his own curiosity, especially in the kitchen. (And many of my breakable knick-knacks have fallen victim to his curiosity, too.) "Yaw" is a nautical term, and "suttee" is a voluntary form of suicide (by cremation) that some Hindu widows used to commit, throwing themselves on their husbands' funeral pyres.

questions.text: Daunt Luke caw give doors Sunday moth?
questions.correct: Dont look a gift horse in the mouth & Don t look a gift horse in the mouth&Don't look a gift horse in the mouth
questions.explanation:
Dont look a gift horse in the mouth & Don t look a gift horse in the mouth&Don't look a gift horse in the mouth.

	Horse traders look in horses' mouths--at their teeth--in order to determine their ages. If somebody gives you a horse as a gift, looking in the horse's mouth might be considered rudely ungrateful. In other words, if something good happens to you, just accept it--don't start calculating its value.

questions.correct: A dog in the manger & A dog in a manger
questions.explanation:
A dog in the manger & A dog in a manger.

	A dog in the manger is a killjoy or someone who prevents others from enjoying what he himself cannot use.

questions.text: Cur rye ink cracker dial tiers?
questions.explanation:
Crying crocodile tears.

	To cry crocodile tears means to pretend that you feel regret or sorrow when you actually don't. A crocodile's eye-moistening glands are so close to the creature's throat that the act of swallowing forces moisture from them. Apparently, this process makes the croc appear to weep as it gobbles up its prey.
